variant.question:
Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed decreases, induced drag increases.   
2\. When mass decreases, induced drag increases.
What kind of drag will a fairing smoothening the angles where the wing meets the fuselage at the wing root reduce?

An aeroplane has a CL (lift coefficient) of 0.6 and a CDI (induced drag coefficient) value of 0.1 in level flight. The aeroplane slows down while maintaining level flight. The lift coefficient increased by a factor of 1.5 to maintain lift at the lower speed. If there is NO change in configuration, what is the new CDI?
What is the effect of increasing wing aspect ratio on induced drag?

options.text: It is unaffected because there is no relation between aspect ratio and induced drag.
It increases because increasing aspect ratio increases frontal area.
It reduces because the effect of wing-tip vortices is reduced.
It increases because increasing aspect ratio produces greater downwash.

variant.question: An aeroplane’s Lift/Drag (L/D) ratio is...

options.text: obtained by multiplying CL with CD.
the inverse of the glide ratio.

variant.question: Which of the following causes an increase in downwash behind a wing?
What would happen to an aircraft’s rate of descent and the angle of descent when deploying the speed brakes in flight?

options.text: Both the rate of descent and the descent angle will decrease.
Both the rate of descent and the descent angle will increase.
The rate of descent will decrease and the descent angle will increase.
The rate of descent will increase and the descent angle will decrease.

variant.question: Which of the following would cause a reduction in interference drag?

options.text: Increasing the wingspan and reducing the mean geometric chord length.
Reducing the number of external surfaces meeting at an angle.
Ensuring that all external surfaces meet at close to 90 degrees.
Tapering the fuselage to a point at the tail.

variant.question:
Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed increases, induced drag increases.  
2\. When mass increases, induced drag increases.
The value of the induced drag of an aeroplane in straight and level flight at constant mass varies linearly with:
Which plane and situation experiences the least amount of lift reduction?
Which of the following are most effective at reducing induced drag?

options.text: Lower Aspect Ratio and wing fences.
Higher Aspect Ratio and removal of winglets.

variant.question: What is the consequence of decreasing the wing's upwash?

options.text: Increase induced drag since effective AoA increases.
Increase induced drag since decrease of AoA.
Decrease induced drag since effective AoA increases.
Decrease induced drag since decrease of AoA.

variant.question:
Refer to figure.

What is the effect of spoilers on the angle of attack and stall speed at a constant mass?

options.text: With increasing spoilers, both the angle of attack and stall speed increase.
With increasing spoilers, both the angle of attack and stall speed decrease.
With decreasing spoilers, the angle of attack decreases and the stall speed increases.
With increasing spoilers, the angle of attack increases and the stall speed decreases.

variant.question: Which type of aeroplane will experience a larger decrease in induced drag at heights between ground level and a wingspan?

Which of these statements about induced drag are correct or incorrect?

I. An elliptical spanwise lift distribution generates less induced drag than a rectangular lift distribution.   
II. Induced drag decreases with decreasing aspect ratio.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.

variant.question:
Refer to figure.

Which of the four points in the attached graph depicts the maximum lift to drag ratio?
When increasing speed in straight and level flight, induced drag (1)\_\_\_\_\_ and parasite drag (2)\_\_\_\_\_.
Which of the following are means to reduce induced drag?

options.text: Increasing the aspect ratio and wing twist, adding winglets.
Increasing the wing thickness, camber, and span.
Decreasing the taper ratio, increasing the root chord and sweep angle.
Decreasing the wingspan, increasing the approach speed and take-off weight.

variant.question: Assuming constant speed induced drag is:

options.text: proportional to the square of the lift coefficient.
inversely proportional to the square of the lift coefficient.

variant.question: Excluding constants, the coefficient of induced drag (CDI) is the ratio of:
The highest value of the CL/CD ratio of an aeroplane is obtained:

options.text: in the configuration where only the leading edge slats are fully extended.
in the configuration where only the trailing edge flaps are fully extended.
in the configuration where both the leading and trailing edge flaps are fully extended.

variant.question: What happens to induced drag when airspeed increases?

options.text: Induced drag is not affected by airspeed.

variant.question: Assuming no compressibility effects, induced drag at constant IAS is affected by:

Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed decreases, induced drag decreases.   
2\. When mass decreases, induced drag decreases.
Assuming ISA conditions and an aircraft which is travelling at the same IAS, what happens to the drag of the aircraft at 6 000 ft, compared to the drag at sea level?
Which of the following creates induced drag on a wing?

options.text: Airflow around the fuselage and wing root meeting.

variant.question:
Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed decreases, induced drag decreases.   
2\. When mass decreases, induced drag increases.

Calculate the new value of drag force, given: An airplane flying at 100 kt at an angle (alpha 1) of 4º, has a drag coefficient (CD1) of 0.028\. Total drag force is 900 N.  
The airplane decelerates to 55 kt, flying at an angle of attack (alpha 2) of 15º, when drag coefficient (CD2) is 0.148.
Consider two aircraft, the only difference between the two is that one has larger winglets than the other. In the aircraft with the larger winglets, ground effect is expected to:

options.text: increase because winglets increase overall Drag.
decrease because winglets increase overall Drag.
increase because the winglets reduce overall wing tip vortices.
decrease because the winglets reduce overall wing tip vortices.

variant.question: What is the effect on induced drag of an increase in aspect ratio?

options.text: Induced drag decreases, because the effect of tip vortices decreases.
Induced drag decreases, because a larger aspect ratio causes more downwash.
Induced drag increases, because the effect of tip vortices increases.
Induced drag increases, because a larger aspect ratio increases the frontal area.

variant.question: Describe the airflow with regards to the induced drag...

options.text: From the bottom to the top via the tip.
From the top to the bottom via the leading edge.
From the bottom to the top via the trailing edge.
From the top to the bottom via the tip.

variant.question: An aeroplane accelerates from 80 kt to 160 kt at a load factor equal to 1\. By what factors will the induced drag coefficient (i) and the induced drag (ii) change?
Which of these variables are required to calculate drag from the drag formula?

options.text: Dynamic pressure, drag coefficient and wing area.
Total pressure and wing area only.
Frontal wing area, density and wing loading.
Angle of attack, aspect ratio and dynamic pressure.

variant.question: Which statement is true regarding a reduction in induced drag?

options.text: Decrease upwash and decrease induced angle of attack.
Increase upwash and decrease induced angle of attack.
Increase downwash and decrease the induced angle of attack.
Decrease downwash and increase induced angle of attack.

variant.question: Induced drag is the result of:

options.text: boundary layer separation on the aft portion of the wing.

variant.question: Considering the polar curve of a subsonic aerofoil, the maximum lift-to-drag ratio is determined by...

options.text: the minimum value of the drag coefficient.
drawing a tangent to the curve from the origin.
the maximum value of the lift coefficient.
the point where total lift and total drag are equal.

variant.question: Which of the following wing planforms produces the lowest induced drag? (assume zero wing twist)
How can the induced drag in a wing/aircraft be increased?

options.text: By increasing the angle of attack.
By the flow around the fuselage meeting with the wing root.

variant.question: The coefficient of drag can be defined as the...

options.text: ratio of drag pressure to dynamic pressure.
ratio of lift forces to drag forces.
sum of induced drag and parasite drag.
measure of the efficiency of the aeroplane.

variant.question: If the airspeed reduces in level flight below the speed for maximum L/D, the total drag of an aeroplane will:

options.text: increase because of increased induced drag.
reduce because of reduced friction drag.
reduce because of reduced induced drag.
increase because of increased parasite drag.

variant.question: At a load factor of 1 and the aeroplane's minimum drag speed, what is the ratio between induced drag DI and parasite drag DP?
Induced drag is created by the:

options.text: interference of the air stream between wing and fuselage.
propeller wash blowing across the wing.
spanwise flow pattern resulting in the tip vortices.
separation of the boundary layer over the wing.

variant.question:
Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed decreases, induced drag increases.   
2\. When mass decreases, induced drag decreases.

Given a constant load factor, which of these statements is correct about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed increases, induced drag decreases.   
2\. When mass increases, induced drag decreases.
Which type of aeroplane and situation will experience a larger decrease in induced drag at heights between ground level and a wingspan?
Coefficient of lift is:

options.text: A variable depending on dynamic pressure and the wing area
A variable depending on thrust and empange
A variable depending on static pressure and the wing area
A variable depending on wing camber and static pressure

variant.question: The induced drag coefficient, CDI is proportional to:
If you are flying at the rear of the drag curve and your CAS decreases, what happens to the parasite, induced and total drag?

options.text: Parasite drag decreases; Induced drag increases; Total drag increases
Parasite drag increases; Induced drag decreases; Total drag decreases
Parasite drag decreases; Induced drag increases; Total drag decreases
Parasite drag increases; Induced drag decreases; Total drag increases

variant.question:
Given a constant load factor, which of these statements about the variation of induced drag with changes of speed and mass are correct or incorrect?

1\. When speed increases, induced drag decreases.   
2\. When mass increases, induced drag increases.
